intro: Zexmenia aurantiaca, commonly known as the golden tangerine orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking orange-red petals and a unique, fragrant scent that attracts specific pollinators. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its leaves are broad and glossy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, Zexmenia aurantiaca is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
